MyArm
GITEICaptoglove.​Module
public
GITEICaptoglove.​MyArm

Handles Captoglove module configured as forearm sensor.

Author
Laura Moreno

laamo[xxx]renoro@unal.[xxx]edu.co

Copyrigth

Copyrigth 2020 GITEI Universidad Nacional de Colombia, all rigths reserved.

Types
eArmType
public enum eArmType

List of possible ways to use Captoglove module with this class:

TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM

As right forearm sensor

TYPE_LEFT_FOREARM

As left forearm sensor

Functions
MyArm
public MyArm(
int nID,
eArmType eType
)

Initializes variables for Captoglove module configuration.

Parameters
nID
int

Captoglove ID (4 digits number)

etype
eArmType

Captoglove use mode

Example
MyArm RightArm = new MyArm(2469, MyArm.eArmType.TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM);
SetArmType
private void SetArmType(
eArmType eType
)

Saves Captoglove module use mode.

Parameters
eType
eArmType

Captoglove module use mode

Example
SetArmType(MyHand.eHandType.TYPE_RIGHT_FOREARM);
GetArmType
public eArmType GetArmType()
Returns

Captoglove module use mode

SetArmTransform
public int SetArmTransform(
Transform tArmObj,
eModuleAxis ePitchAxis,
eModuleAxis eYawAxis,
eModuleAxis eRollAxis
)

Attaches Captoglove module movement to arm transform.

Parameters
tArmObj
Transform

Forearm transform

ePitchAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for pitch movement

eYawAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for yaw movement

eRollAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for roll movement

Returns
0

Success

-1

Error: Transform error

Example
SetArmTransform(transRA, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_X, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_Z, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_Y);
Notes

Place the arm transform horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function.

SetInitialArmRot
public void SetInitialArmRot(
float fRotX,
float fRotY,
float fRotZ
)

Saves initial rotation for arm transform.

Parameters
fRotX
float

Forearm transform

fRotY
float

Transform axis for pitch movement

fRotZ
float

Transform axis for yaw movement

Example
SetInitialArmRot(0, 90, -90);
Notes

Use this function to manually set the initial rotation of arm transform in case SetArmTransform() is saving wrong values by default.  Use this function after SetArmTransform().

SetDefaultRotLimits
private void SetDefaultRotLimits()

Set the limits for the rotation of the arm transform.

Notes

The values configured in this function are valid only for the arm model delivered with these libraries.

SetPitchLimits
public void SetPitchLimits(
float fMaxUpRotation,
float fMaxDownRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for pitch movement of the arm.

Parameters
fMaxUpRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing upward in the pitch movement

fMaxDownRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing downward in the pitch movement

Example
SetPitchLimits(90, -90);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the arm transform.

SetYawLimits
public void SetYawLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for yaw movement of the arm.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing to the right in the yaw movement

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the arm is pointing to the left in the yaw movement

Example
SetYawLimits(90, -90);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the arm transform.

MoveArm
public void MoveArm()

Updates arm transform rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() of your app to simulate arm movement.

SetArmNewAngle
private void SetArmNewAngle()

Calculates arm transform rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

AsignAngle2Axes
private void AsignAngle2Axes(
float fPitchA,
float fYawA,
float fRollA
)

Set rotation angle to each axis of the arm transform.

SaveArmMovInFile
public void SaveArmMovInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves module data in file with following format: x arm rotation; y arm rotation; z arm rotation

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveArmMovInFile("RightArmMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() of your app to save data continuously
